title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2A.06 - Design of Signs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2A.06 - Design of Signs

State Regulations
INSERT the following paragraphs: Standard: 13A Any change to a word message sign that can be
considered more than a minor modification (see Section
1A.03
) shall be approved by the

New York State Department of Transportation before it is implemented. Option: 17A Where it is deemed necessary to identify the regulating
authority, regulatory signs may bear the authority's name, initials, or
symbol. Standard: 17B Where used on regulatory signs, the regulatory
authority name or symbol shall not be more than one-half inch high, and shall
be located near the bottom of the sign. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
2A.06

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
